Articles.Content:
Solution: (from Supernovy of the IRC chat) The mouse cursor has to be directly over the decouplers when placing the boosters. This happened easily with the small boosters, but I was not doing this for the large boosters. Problem Solved!

The TT-38K radial decoupler worked fine when under beta (0.9), but ever since I updated to alpha (ver 1.0.2.842) I cannot attach boosters onto the decouplers. When I put the boosters on my rocket, they attach directly to the "main" fuselage (directly under the command module) right in the same spot as the decouplers. Right over them, in fact; they are clipping into each other. 

When I try testing out the rocket (specifically, 1 RT-10 solid booster with 3 RT-10 boosters attached radially) I fire the the three outside boosters, but when I click to activate the radial decouplers, they explode normally (inside of the outside boosters) and fall off without damaging anything, but the three outside boosters remain attached to the rocket. I couldn't find any helpful fixes or documentation of this bug, so I made this new post. 

Remember:

The decouplers worked fine in Beta, but not in the latest update.

I am a beginning KSP player.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-21T02:01:34Z" title="05/21/2015 02:01  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 21, 2015</time> by socxc9**
  
Found solution

[http://imgur.com/moV8Ywn](http://imgur.com/moV8Ywn) the RT-10 boosters not connecting to the decouplers. You can see them poking out. I know, there are two sets of decouplers, but it wouldn't work with just one set either.

[http://imgur.com/t5vOqT8](http://imgur.com/t5vOqT8) Nevermind the weird design, turns out smaller boosters connect just fine.
